summary: This is an email chain from October 2019 within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a request to estimate the number of human trafficking victim interviews conducted by units in the past year. The response notes that the estimated number of roughly 30 interviews for 2019 is heavily driven by the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator
persons.context: The sender of the initial request email asking units to report on the number of human trafficking victim interviews conducted in the past year.

events.title: Estimate of Victim Interviews in SDNY
events.description: An estimate that roughly 30 unique victim or potential victim interviews related to human trafficking were conducted in 2019, heavily driven by the Epstein investigation.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator

keyFacts: The document is an internal 2019 email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding human trafficking victim interviews.
The response estimates roughly 30 such interviews were conducted in 2019, a number heavily driven by the Epstein investigation.
The request seeks to understand the volume of human trafficking victim interviews, regardless of whether cases were charged.
The correspondence highlights the ongoing investigative activity related to the Epstein case within the SDNY in late 2019.
